titleStmt.title: Tom Tel-Troths come to town againe with his humors. Vnder which humour is contained these particulars: viz. A rope for a parat. A bable for a foole. A springe for a woodcocke. And a snare for a fox. Collected and published to make honest and wise men merry, or fooles and knaves mad.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: for Th: Lambert neere the Red Crosse in Little Britaine,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to John Taylor, the water poet, by Stonehill.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Red Crosse in Little Britaine
